contextId.information: The phrase "eyes of your heart" expresses one's ability to gain understanding. AT: "that you may gain understanding and be enlightened" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened

contextId.information: "seated Christ at God's right hand" or "seated Christ in the place of honor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: seated him at his right hand

contextId.information: This expresses the behavior of how people live. AT: "you once lived" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"so believers can help each other grow in love" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: so that the whole body grows and builds itself up in love

contextId.information: Walking is a metaphor for the way people live their lives. AT: "stop living like the Gentiles with their worthless thoughts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: no longer are you to walk as the Gentiles walk in the futility of their minds

contextId.information: "You must stop being angry before night comes" or "Let go of your anger before the day ends" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Do not let the sun go down on your anger

contextId.information: The words "stand firm" are an idiom meaning to "firmly resist." See how you translated "stand firm" in [[:en:bible:notes:eph:06:12|6:13]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
